citation.article-title: Characterization of two novel saccharolytic, anaerobic thermophiles, Thermoanaerobacterium polysaccharolyticum sp. nov. and Thermoanaerobacterium zeae sp. nov., and emendation of the genus Thermoanaerobacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: The genus Thermoanaerobacterium has been previously described (Lee et al., 1993b; Liu et al., 1996b). According to the description, members of the genus reduce thiosulfate to elemental sulfur. However, both Thermoanaerobacterium polysaccharolyticum and Thermoanaerobacterium zeae are unable to reduce thiosulfate to elemental sulfur and, therefore, the reduction of thiosulfate to elemental sulfur is not a distinguishing characteristic of the genus Thermoanaerobacterium. This emendment to the genus description also rectifies the placement of Thermoanaerobacterium thermosaccharolyticum, another organism which reduces thiosulfate to sulfide, not elemental sulfur (Collins et al., 1994; McClung, 1935).
